SENT.plain: PURPOSE: Behçet disease is most common in Asia, the Middle East, and North Africa (Silk Road)
The authors compare clinical presentation and course of Behçet uveitis in patients of Silk Road and non-Silk Road descent
METHODS: Retrospective review of patients evaluated at the University of Illinois January 1983-July 2010
RESULTS: Of 6134 new uveitis patients, 36 with available medical records met diagnostic criteria for Behçet disease
Ten (28%) were of Silk Road origin
Retinal vasculitis was the most common ocular manifestation, followed by panuveitis and retinitis
Ocular and systemic manifestations were similar between groups
Seventy-eight percent were treated with systemic immunosuppression, which reduced inflammatory attack rate
CONCLUSIONS: Behçet disease is uncommon in the midwestern United States
Three-quarters of patients in this series were not of Silk Road descent
Physicians should consider the diagnosis of Behçet disease in any patient with retinal vasculitis or uveitis regardless of ethnicity
